item.title: Every time there is rain the road floods and it cause a huge puddle on both sides of the road., 26th November

item.title: Loose sign post, 26th November
item.description:

item.title: Cleanup needed, 26th November
item.description:
The Arts Depot is supposed to be a flagship for North Finchley, attracting people to cultural events. The pedestrianised Nether St outside however is strewn with litter. It looks like a dump.

item.title: Residential & DIY rubbish dumped, 26th November
item.description:
Two bags of rubbish left first on skate shop 27 leinster terraces doorstep, then moved back to to 27A/B's doorstep. Although this is private land , this toutine flytipping is causing a prejuidicial health hazard, and ASB by moving onto next doors property. Please refer to environmental health enforcement. Please see previous cases: CAS-1535506-G8B3W2. CAS-1525373-W6W4M3. CAS-1505887-S1J7S9

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Leinster Terrace, Bayswater, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Under the pavement, groundswater seeping through the wall of the first vault of number 60, 26th November
item.description:
According to Thames Water this is groundswater seeping through the wall. Reported to Thames Water Aug 23. Thames Water performed a number of investigations and replaced part of their old valves. Water ingress didn't stop. Thames Water analysed the water for ammonia and chlorine. Oct 17 the results from the lab came as negative. Thames Water reports that the source must be groundswater or stormdrain leakage seeping from the under the road into the vaults.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Delancey Street, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle blocking driveway, 26th November
item.description:
This car has been left here from the start of November 2026 There seems to be multiple ticket fines on it but there doesnâ€™t seem to be any intention of the owner recovering the vehicle. It is blocking my driveway making it difficult to get cars in and out. It is facing the wrong way on a one way road and has its window slightly ajar leading me to believe it might have been stolen and then abandoned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Florence Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
